name: Turkish Music
description: Traditions developed by the Turkish people.

children.name: Anatolian Rock
children.description: Incorporates elements of Turkish Folk Music, particularly traditional instruments such as the bağlama and saz alongside traditional scales and melodies.

children.name: Arabesk
children.description: Arabic-style productions by Turkish musicians, who also draw influence from their native forms, including Turkish Folk Music, Balkan Music, and Byzantine Music.

children.name: Fantezi
children.description: Incorporates influences from Turkish Classical Music and Turkish Folk Music within a more accessible, commercial, and unorthodox context.

children.name: Kanto
children.description: Songs performed at the Tuluat Theaters of İstanbul in the late 19th century.

children.name: Ottoman Military Music
children.description: Considered the oldest military marching band in the world; instruments used are cymbals, trumpet, kös drum, kettle drum, naqareh, bells, and cevgen.

children.name: Turkish Classical Music
children.description: Classical music of Turkey, which uses the makam modal system, with the primary emphasis often being on the singers, who are accompanied by small ensembles.

children.name: Turkish Folk Music
children.description: Traditional Folk Music of Turkish people combines the distinct cultural heritages and traditions of Anatolian civilisations and former Ottoman territories.

children.name: Turkish Pop
children.description: Started in the late 1950s, when Turkish artists started to write their own lyrics to Western popular tunes.

children.name: Özgün Müzik
children.description: Expansion of Turkish Folk Music with overtones from contemporary genres.
